definitions.definition: A sentence, phrase or word which asks for information, reply or response; an interrogative.
A subject or topic for consideration or investigation.
definitions.example: The question of seniority will be discussed at the meeting.

definitions.definition: A doubt or challenge about the truth or accuracy of a matter.
A proposal to a meeting as a topic for deliberation.
definitions.example: I move that the question be put to a vote.

definitions.definition: (chiefly with definite article) Interrogation by torture.
To ask questions about; to interrogate; to enquire for information.
To raise doubts about; have doubts about.
To argue; to converse; to dispute.
A game in which players must only say questions, and if they don't they lose.
